questions.title: Meaning & Purpose of Informal Letter
questions.question: What is an Informal Letter and what is its purpose?
paragraphs: 1. MEANING: • An informal letter is a personal letter written to friends, family members, or relatives. • It is written in a friendly and conversational tone.
2. PURPOSE: Informal letters are written to: • Share news or feelings • Congratulate or thank someone • Invite or apologize • Ask or give information • Keep in touch

questions.title: Format of an Informal Letter
questions.question: What is the format of an Informal Letter?
paragraphs: An Informal Letter has 8 parts:
(a) SENDER'S ADDRESS: • Write your full address on the top left corner • Example: Dhvani, 16/8, 21st Cross Street, Indira Nagar, Adyar, Chennai – 600020.
(b) DATE: • Write the date just below the address • Example: 10th February, 2026.
(c) SALUTATION: • Use a friendly greeting • Examples: - Dear Mom, - Dear Vidyut, - My dear Uncle,
(d) INTRODUCTION / OPENING PARAGRAPH: • Begin with a warm greeting and state the reason for writing • Example: I hope you are doing well. I am writing to tell you about...
(e) BODY / MAIN PARAGRAPHS: • Write the main message — share your thoughts, experiences, or news in detail • Use a natural and friendly tone
(f) CONCLUSION / CLOSING PARAGRAPH: • End with good wishes or a positive note • Example: Give my regards to everyone at home. Hope to see you soon.
(g) COMPLIMENTARY CLOSE: • End the letter politely • Examples: - Yours lovingly, - Yours affectionately, - With love,
(h) SIGNATURE: • Write your first name below the closing • Example: Anirudh

questions.title: Key Points to Remember
questions.question: What are the key points to remember when writing an Informal Letter?
paragraphs: KEY POINTS TO REMEMBER:
✓ Use simple and polite language
✓ Write neatly and clearly
✓ Keep the tone friendly and personal
✓ Avoid short forms like "u" or "btw"
✓ Use proper punctuation and grammar

questions.title: Sample Letter Layout
questions.question: Show a sample layout of an Informal Letter.
paragraphs: Dhvani, 16/8, 21st Cross Street, Indira Nagar, Adyar, Chennai – 600020. 10th February, 2026.
Dear Vidyut,
How are you? I hope you and your family are doing well. It's been a long time since we met, so I thought of writing to tell you about my summer holidays.

This summer, I visited Ooty with my parents and grandparents. The weather was cool and pleasant, and the hills were covered with beautiful flowers. We went boating on the lake, visited the Botanical Gardens, and took a toy train ride to Coonoor. It was so much fun! I also clicked many pictures and tried delicious homemade chocolates.
The best part was spending time with my family and enjoying nature away from the city noise. I really wish you had come with us — you would have loved it!
Do write back soon and tell me how you spent your holidays. Give my regards to Uncle and Aunty.
Yours lovingly, Anirudh
